Content: The Central Bank has announced that Sri Lanka Rupee has been strengthened when compared with the US dollar. With the changes in the world economy, Sri Lankaâ€™s rupee was depreciated last year. Reports say that the rupee depreciated by 16.4 percent when compared with the US dollar. The Central Bank implemented long term and short term programmes as a solution to the exchange problem. As a result, the Central Bank says the rupee has appreciated by 0.6 percent. The selling rate of the dollar at present is 180 rupees and 19 cents and the buying rate is 176 rupees and 34 cents.
